title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill now includes various education programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training programs. The GI Bill now covers education programs like apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training programs at approved establishments. The GI Bill covers education programs at approved establishments, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable for training programs. The GI Bill covers education programs at approved establishments, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable for training programs, including fees, housing stipend, and a monthly stipend of $83. The GI Bill covers education programs at approved establishments, providing a monthly stipend of $83 for books, supplies, and equipment. The total amount of educational assistance paid determines the number of months of entitlement for the training program. The GI Bill covers education programs at approved establishments, providing a monthly stipend for books, supplies, and equipment. Payment of educational assistance for training cannot exceed the individual's available entitlement under this chapter. The GI Bill provides educational assistance for veterans, with a limit of 12 months and $15,000 in total assistance. The Secretary adjusts payments based on the individual's eligibility compared to others under specific subsections. The Post-9/11 GI Bill is being amended to include approved programs and franchise training opportunities for individuals pursuing education. The Post-9/11 GI Bill is being amended to include training programs at approved establishments, with funding for fees assessed by the training establishment. The Post-9/11 GI Bill is being amended to include training programs at approved establishments, with funding for fees assessed by the training establishment. A monthly housing stipend equal to the basic allowance for housing under title 37 is provided for each month of training pursued. The Post-9/11 GI Bill now includes a monthly housing stipend based on the basic allowance for housing under title 37 for members with dependents in pay grade E-5 residing in the military housing area that covers the ZIP code area of the training establishment. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides a monthly stipend for training expenses, including books, supplies, and equipment, equal to $83 per month or $15,000 total. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides a monthly stipend for training expenses, including books, supplies, and equipment, equal to $83 per month or $15,000 total. For individuals entitled to educational assistance under specific sections, the payable amounts are determined by multiplying the specified amounts by the applicable percentage. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides monthly educational assistance up to $15,000, with specific limitations on the duration and total amount a veteran can receive. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides monthly educational assistance up to $15,000, with specific limitations on the duration and total amount a veteran can receive. Payments for pursuing a training program at a designated establishment are made upon certification of enrollment. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides monthly educational assistance up to $15,000, with limitations on duration and total amount. Payments are made upon the Secretary receiving a certification of enrollment from the establishment.
